tG7es3zomPAcapzEruvzqg.text: Awesome freaking waffles.  Nutella, speculoos ice cream, chocolate syrup, and whipped cream is my combo of choice.  Yeah.

mo3kuAxCKuwfb9pMHwezkg.text: A great sweet treat for a late night snack! The waffles are superb, and you can top it with chocolate, nutella, ice cream, fruit....whatever you want.

mk2SELxEf698jErcD73CdQ.text: The best treat ever! Don't forget to ask for speculoos ice cream and whipped cream. The Biscoff butter/ nutella add to the chewy warm goodness hidden under the bananas, strawberries, whipped cream and chocolate sauce. A delight indeed!

k7wwh7NP51mG5gvnXgZ19w.text: After a trip to the main library, I would often take my kids for a ride on the merry-go-round, followed up by a sweet treat here. This is like the end of a perfect go to Saturday for us. I love this place and honestly, they serve the best Belgian waffles I've had since I was last in Belgium! YuuM!!

h9-kaaIQb-gAakEqs_jntA.text: On a beautiful day, you can't beat sitting out at the tables or on the grass in Oakland eating one of these dense, gooey waffles with fresh cream. These things are truly amazing, even with a plastic fork. Love!

sU5hMXISqFsPBSjvh0Pzrw.text: Sooooo good!!! Waffle with ice cream, but way better than anything else I've had! Sooo good!

AaWHiShNV7vX1HNl5w5AmQ.text: I went here for the first time a few days ago and it was pretty good, but not heart stopping good. I like my food relatively pure so I got the basic sugar or liege waffle topped with whipped cream. Parts of the waffle were super-duper sweet (like licking a cube of sugar covered in real maple syrup sweet). The sweetness don't stop me, because the whipped cream helped balance it out. If you don't mind paying $4-9 for a simple and relatively small waffle then give this place a try. The waffle iron could have used a good cleaning to avoid burnt sugar all over the waffle, but it was tasty enough. I recommend going here for a snack or with kids, but not as a meal option unless you want to buy 2-3 individual waffles per person. I plan to go to the original Squirrel Hill location, because I've been told that it is so much better.

j7Qu5oXF1ycWhuRm3450rw.text: I gave Waffalonia my heart the first time I saw the words "sugar waffle."  The deliciousness has fulfilled me and I don't need it back.

9Tu8f-GxmTYyZ3vNIMyUGg.text: on my way from hillman library to cathedral of  learning , I just couldn't help stopping to buy a piece of waffle as a reward for a day's hardworking. I tried cream with fresh strawberries and tried ice cream with chocolate topping. The cold ice cream is a perfect match with the hot waffle. You should definitely choose this although the price is not low. The good thing is you can use card here. And no need to worry about forgetting bringing some cash with you.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kagKgEx4weSpu0EtcmnXwA.text: I've been here a few times and always love it! This afternoon my son and I shared a waffle with Nutella, bananas and strawberries. It's just so good. I always get the same thing but next time I will definitely try the ice cream since there are so many flavors,  including Nutella ice cream! This treat always reminds me of a crepe but I think it's even easier to eat. The waffle is crispy and sweet with the perfect ratio of Nutella so that it's not drowning in it.   This location is so convenient in Oakland and perfect for a treat after a carousel ride.

55rA0LTM3Ogjj9wtMJ-tvA.text: Of course..nothing can beat waffles from Brussels (particularly from Maison Dandoy). But this version tasted super artificial..like waffles from a box.

w2UCmzRxtfQxVVfCOp1jPQ.text: Sweet mother of all that is dessert-y.  I have to write this review even before finishing my waffle (topped with the irresistible Dave & Andy's cinnamon ice cream). This is one of the best waffles I've ever eaten. Come here. Order a waffle. Melt into a puddle of happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waffle with Dave &amp; Andy&#39;s cinnamon ice cream!

ZXrFi0p48s05bYXv17o5bQ.text: I couldn't hold off eating my waffle long enough to take a picture... Though I promise you, it was a thing of beauty. The waffles are somewhat doughy, a hint of sweet, and ever so moist. I opted for some Nutella ice cream on top (which was most definitely the-bomb-dot-com). I may seriously be disappointed by all other waffles from here on out.

5rrLtBUNkL65nwodEXbohw.text: I stopped by for a snack on a beautiful weekday afternoon. While there wasn't much of a wait, the stand was definitely popular. I don't think the worker said a word to me (except for the price), but he seemed pleasant.  When you order a waffle, he takes a ball of pre-portioned dough and plops it into the waffle iron, which can hold about four at a time. The waffle is then placed in a cardboard box and topped. I got my waffle with speculoos spread.  The waffle was delicious: crisp on the outside, soft on the inside, and warm. It tasted great by itself, but its holes were great for holding the speculoos, which tasted like liquid butter cookies and had the consistency of warm peanut butter. It wasn't too sweet, either, and the amount didn't overpower the waffle. A great treat for the middle of the day! Though the waffle is small, it's thick. It's a good portion size and fairly priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waffle with Speculoos spread, $4

wHhLrU75ObwI7eWm40knSw.text: YUM. I've been to this location and the slightly larger one in Squirrel Hill, and no complaints. They have sugar-y waffles and ice cream, coffee, espresso, bananas, strawberries, Nutella, tasty whipped cream... It's a great place to get dessert if you're in Oakland but you're not in the mood for froyo or straight up ice cream.

-zAm3nLya0lO9yasjlxX-w.text: A great great place to go for some delicious waffles! I walk here often and have ordered the Antwerp Waffle. The sugar waffles are also great! I usually get Antwerp (sugar waffle with ice cream and chocolate sauce) with sliced strawberries- its a good sweet combination of hot and cold. There usually is not a long line, unless its a very hot day; but it might take a while to get your waffle. There is only one person who takes your order and makes the waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Antwerp (sugar waffle+chocolate sauce+ice cream) with freshly sliced strawberries

xZZPMpq3_KZ0inNXiuj8Eg.text: 5 stars out of 5!  This place is a gold mine! It is exactly what the Pitt campus needed. The waffles taste superb. They are flaky, sweet, and have a nice subtle crisp on the outside. Trying to pick which kind of waffle is the tough part, I have been there 3 times and have gotten the 'Bruges' (Strawberries & Whipped Cream), 'Namur' (Bananas & Nutella), and 'Ghent' (Bananas & Speculoos spread*). *(For those of you wondering what speculoos spread is, it is a graham cracker based 'nutella-like' spread... and it is phenomenal!)*. All three waffles were made perfectly, and all tasted devine. I highly recommend this place. I can't wait to continue to tame my sweet tooth at this wonderful establishment. They are a bit pricy once you start adding a bunch of toppings, but it is absolutely worth is.

cj0UmnuMiZwwj-k9wtqaOA.text: This place is the place to be when you want to satisfy a craving.  It will satisfy all of those dirty sweet pleasure you have. Phenomenal waffles and great topping selection.  I always see students chowing down on some waffles.  When the students go, you go!

4JYskV4uNYGJ8LgQx4bXWw.text: This was my first experience with Waffallonia. I decided to go with Namur: bananas, Nutella on sugar waffle. It was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Freshly cut bananas. Polite and expedited service. Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Namur: bananas, Nutella on sugar waffle

A0SoY585E_LiF9rz2vOX3g.text: So good! Always an impulse buy! Waffles+Fruit+Nutella... what's not to like?

Rw0U80jmr8Brl_1MIHO7aw.text: I had been hearing about Waffallonia from friends and acquaintances but Squirrel Hills is somewhat of a hike for me in my South Hills location so I was pleasantly surprised to see a stand in Schenley Plaza.  I ordered a waffle with speculous and vanilla ice cream - it was delish!  It was HUGE, so huge that I had to throw 1/2 of it away which felt like a crime but I was seriously getting nauseous from the richness of it all.    This makes me want to throw caution to the wind and drive on over to Squirrel Hill!  I highly recommend checking this place out if you have a sweet tooth.

GwJXRa0RV2ngxsfhbhUzZA.text: It was raw, I tell you, it was raw!   Cook the frigging waffle until the dough in the middle is cooked!  So much potential, so poorly cooked.  Didn't find out til I was on the run, away from the stand.  Bummer for me.  If it was cooked, would have given 4 stars!!

YCcRKoJ_mReDrCr-dFXn7w.text: We love this place! The waffles are sugary and crisp on the outside but moist and fluffy on the inside. I usually get the banana, strawberry, and Nutella. Melts in your mouth!!!!

WrXOnzOcXTppVcTe76SzxQ.text: Had the waffle with cinnamon ice cream. It was good, but not $6 good. It's somewhat of a trap bc if you really want a waffle that's the only option nearby.  If you really want a waffle and price is no option then this is the place to go.

MoSIG7HktZILd09Z2vReVg.text: The best waffles in town. They're Liege-style with pearl sugar, and they're incredible.

9PW0Vh3X9rbwEWMnv8naVA.text: Good location for pitt student. I like the milk shake. The waffle, I can't say it's great but it is not bad. You get more from the Nutella and banana than the waffle itself. But if we don't look at it so strictly and compare it to authentic Belgian ones, it's good.

-TNvDSwNZNw3jcQ_IyDSyg.text: Although the service can be a bit slow at times the Antwerp with vanilla ice cream is worth the wait. I'd recommend paying this place a visit if you like good homemade Belgium Waffles.

nmwV5R2qdUhWfnSV-plJPA.text: I absolutely love Waffallonia and always tell my friends about it. Although it is a little on the pricey end for the size of the waffle you get (only problem I had with it), it's delicious and definitely worth treating yourself to every once in a while. They serve Dave & Andy's ice cream with their waffles (if you get ice cream as a topping) but even a plain sugar waffle is satisfying enough because it's so sweet. I haven't ever had a problem with the workers at this location (Schenley Plaza vendor) and even people I've spoken on the phone with have been very friendly and polite.

Oke88G1hbBdz32NceM3BUw.text: These waffles are taaasty! They're sweet, but not too sweet. Additionally, its a tiny, chill place to relax. The only bad thing is that it gets pretty cramped easily if there are too many people around. Five people standing can fill the place up entirely.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MvA4mr9ME8CYWjA8WBiCuQ.text: It pains me to give Waffalonia 2/5 stars but after my last experience, it has to be done. I would say that 90% of my experiences at Waffalonia have been great but this past weekend was truly yucky  I went this past weekend with some friends who were visiting from out of town. The girl baking the waffles didn't have her long hair tied back and I found ~4 hairs in my waffle. After the fourth hair, I took my waffle up to the front desk to bring attention to the issue and without even looking at my waffle, the shift supervisor (different from the girl baking my waffle) said, "I don't want to tell you that you're wrong but those are sugar strings from our batter...not hair." At that point, I pulled out a long hair from the waffle and only then did she admit that it was a hair. No apologies or effort on their end to rectify the situation.  I actually had to ask for a refund before she agreed. Very disappointing.

zjNItNyXMXKViNOK8bZaXQ.text: I really adore anything with sugar. This place is fantastic! If you are in the area, get a waffle here! I can't wait to go back to Pittsburgh to have another..

rt2J9q_dVNrOAfSJIwjolA.text: While I fully endorse and 100% recommend the Waffallonia on Murray Ave(Squirrel Hill), I was completely disappointed by the one on Forbes. I spotted this branch when walking by with some friends from out of town this weekend and had to drag everyone to try my "favorite dessert in the burgh"! When we got to the counter, the girl at the window seemed busy and so we waited for her to look up. In a couple minutes when she made no move to even acknowledge the 4 of us at her window, I said erm.. excuse me, are you open? No response while she continues to busily work on something at her chair. Now I reaaallly wanted my friends to try this so I tried again, just in case she hadn't heard me the first time (although she probably had). "Excuse me, are you open?" .. "You'll have to wait one moment".. comes the curt reply while she continues to look down doing whatever it is she was busy with. We wait.. for a whole 15 minutes.. only because I insisted to my friends that it's gonna totally be worth the wait (and her attitude)! Finally she looked up, annoyed that we decided to keep waiting - "Yes?". I proceeded to order the same exact thing as I always get at the other branch - The Antwerp with the Nutella ice cream and speculoos sauce. We'd run out of patience and to spare her the effort, decided on just the one to share. Now the best thing about Waffallonia, is that warm fresh soft waffle and the cold scoop of ice cream over it! Gosh I could eat one now! BUTTT imagine my disappointment when she slapped a cold hard waffle, made who knows how long before onto a plate and a bunch of goopy melted ice-cream that was dripping from the sides already and handed it to me! We'd waited all this while, so I paid for it. When she handed me my change, I asked for a receipt and she said the machine was broken! Hmm... Well.. my much hyped up "Antwerp" was a complete fail.. and my friends think I'm ridiculous for talking up these waffles!!! But I told them and I'm telling you - Go to the Squirrel Hill branch. It's less than two miles away. Because THAT is the best dessert in the Burgh. This one on Forbes is just it's mean twin!

Z6etDiarnmQzPpkQ2bUZ2w.text: Recently, I was looking for something sweet and decided on a waffle with the nutella. I was impressed with the quality of the waffle! It was dense and sweet and really delicious! The nutella melted on the waffle to add some sweetness. Definitely will come back and try again. Worth it for the price!

XpJOoqfs2CUlSauLEsoHjg.text: I love this little place. They make waffles in such a way that I haven't had since I was a child. There's a hint of salt that adds a ton of depth to the waffle's flavor. I usually get my waffle with cinnamon ice cream... my god. If you're having a bad day, this combo will soothe your aching heart like a comforting mother; if you're having a good day, go here and treat yourself, you've earned it.   The fifth star here comes solely from the euphoria inducing nexus of fresh waffle and not-too-sweet ice cream. From the moment I start eating it, it's a race to the death (of the waffle): can I take the last bite while the waffle is still warm?   If this was any better, it would be a schedule 1 narcotic.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waffle with cinnamon ice cream
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cinnamon ice cream n waffle

75AlZKiDok6tWlrp2yL6Ww.text: Cheap but insanely tasty waffles and coffee. Good desert option in Pitt. Has great selection of different sugar waffles that all look very good especially those with Nutella. The Nutella, banana and strawberry one was the one I tried and was very good.

GM0xNvsuRAZGMT6HWYHJSg.text: Waffallonia is a small booth type of place that sells waffles with different toppings such as fruits, nutella, and ice cream. You can't really go wrong with that!  Pros: We got the Charleroi and it came with nutella, strawberries, bananas, and ice cream! We chose the Speculoos ice cream and it was delicious. Obviously this is pretty much a combo that you can't mess up, so of course it tasted good! The waffle was nice and warm.  Cons: I feel like it was kinda small for around $6-7? If it were $4-5 I wouldn't be complaining, but for $6-7 I would expect something really really special. I would rate this place 3.5 stars, but I rounded down since the service wasn't anything special either, not that friendly.   Overall: I'd come here to satisfy the occasional waffle craving if I lived in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Antwerp and Charleroi!

YzfFwzAg95VNlS4FoP3DHw.text: I liked this cute waffle booth but think they can offer more toppings like nuts. They could also make different waffles like blueberry or pecan. I would also like to see them make a waffle sandwich. My ice cream with strawberries and chocolate was good. I like that there are many food booths around this plaza.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waffle with vanilla ice cream and strawberries chocolate and whipped cream

abM2KZ8AvweCMItEjW9bDg.text: The first thing that drew me to this place (besides the fact that waffles themselves are enough to bring a man to his knees) was the smell. The smell of fresh belgian waffles and ice cream hung in the air. My friend and I had been to the one in Squirrel Hill so we knew what we were in for. At first we doubted the quality of food that could be prepared in a space comparable to that of Harry's cupboard but we were pleasantly surprised!   We had the waffle with speculoos and nutella ice cream. I must advise everyone to get speculoos on their waffle. Why? Because it melts (MELTS) on the warm waffle and becomes a kind of thick syrup and drips over the sides of your perfectly caramelized waffle.  Keep in mind that they do run out of supplies if they get busy so get there before the herd.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

H2n-oxoWBg6epRMM2ZlovQ.text: Make sure to order the Waffallonia!!!   For appx $6.50 you get a sweet sugar waffle with all the toppings you can dream of including but not limited to Nutella, cookie butter, strawberries, bananas, and six different ice cream flavors.   Every waffle I have ordered has been drool worthy. The portion size is perfect and the price is just fair!   The store recently moved just one or two shops down Murray with another location in Oakland. The Murray location is now bigger with more seating but sometimes on busy days you still may have to wait a little for a seat. The turnaround on the waffles is rarely than 5 minutes.   Check it out!!

08M-y6uZZL6QvaV-kJxuNA.text: Cute walk up counter shop with a tasty limited menu. Fair warning - NOT authentic Belgian waffles (if you've ever had a real one from Belgium!), but still tasty  esp with strawberries and whip! A good choice esp if the line at pamelas next door is too long.

4AX33EjlxXC0iiWx0c378g.text: Wow -- absolutely amazing waffles!  After happy hour tonight at The Porch, my husband convinced me to walk over to Waffallonia to give the place a try. The waffles were delicious... soft yet crispy on the exterior and perfectly sweet. They serve up their waffles with Dave & Andy's ice cream. (Well, if you want ice cream... but who wouldn't want ice cream?!) I had never tried Dave & Andy's ice cream before, but after tasting the incredible cinnamon concoction tonight, it's at the top of my must-try places list. I also couldn't resist a little nutella on top.  Even though the prices aren't cheap (approximately $5 per waffle), it's totally worth the cost. I actually appreciated the smaller portion size. You could literally make yourself sick off these waffles!  They offer plenty on the menu to keep you satisfied and trying something new every time... whipped cream, ice cream, chocolate syrup, strawberries, bananas, nutella, and speculoos. (If you're a Trader Joe's shopper, you probably know what speculoos is! It's a magical peanut butter-type spread made from graham crackers.) I'll definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waffle + Speculoos Ice Cream + Chocolate Sauce (since they were out of Nutella :-|)
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious waffles with cinnamon ice cream and chocolate syrup (left) and Nutella (right)

QjE4UGrnEHkkO763fSlfvg.text: Best waffle ever! I got the strawberries and whipped cream on the side. Kinda pricey for me. It is definitely worth it the money.

N2zh_az_pWrLqR8Pv725hA.text: Somewhere in the back of my mind, I know this stand is exploiting my weak self-control: waffle + ice cream + hot summer day = IMMEDIATE IMPULSE BUY. That really doesn't make it any easier to resist though.   There's not much to say in the way of service. The guy working the stand that day seemed pretty bored out of his mind, but he still did his job. Unfortunately, they ran out of milk, so my friend had to change his milkshake order.  The waffle & ice cream we each got essentially lived up to our expectations. Nothing terribly special, just two very sugary desserts combined into one very sugary dessert. It's something you could probably make at home yourself very easily.   My favorite part was the nutella ice cream on mine, which they get from Dave & Andy's just a few streets away. If anything, save yourself a few bucks and calories and head there for your sweet fix instead. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. sugar waffle with nutella ice cream

u0KdI5XWI1d4YWaXwBbzyQ.text: I can't believe I've never reviewed the Oakland Waffalonia! I used to live nearby and made frequent 9pm trips here when a sweet tooth was talking to me.   This location is different than the Sq. Hill one. It's located in Schenley Plaza and it's just a waffle stand.. it's not indoors and doesnt offer seating (plenty of seating at the plaza though) The waffles here taste just as amazing as they do at the Sq. Hill location.  Also, I've had some issues with the other location regarding the friendliness of the workers. The Oakland one is not as bad and actually has friendly workers! (insert raised fist emoji here)  Even though they did a great job at putting a menu together, I always just go with the unlimited waffle ($6+tax) I always order it with: Nutella spead on waffle, Specloos ice cream, strawberries, bananas & chocolate sauce (judge me)   :)

vjP3RfRuaaS3_tRDE0w5HQ.text: Oh waffalonia you've been on my bookmark list for SO long and I finally got to try you today! Service was very friendly and quick. The space is small, stools for 6 at little bars in the back. Plenty of toppings to choose from and Dave and Andys ice cream.  I was recently introduced the liege waffles courtesy of Tartine and I can honestly say, oh lord I may get shot, but I preferred Tartines. That being said, the waffles here are good and the toppings are fantastic, but if you are coming for just the waffle and no toppings then I would say head to the west end village. If you are more interested in a variety of choices then this is your place. The waffle just felt a little under cooked, not as carmelized and crispy as I would prefer. A quick note about the Dave and Andys ice cream, holy cow is the specculos ice cream just to die for!!! Perfectly creamy with just the right amount of cookie butter, this stuff is fantab!!! I'm SO glad there isn't a location closer to me because I'd be as big as a house if there were!!!

IG4IcGBDxviZCOKxsucfQg.text: This was my first visit, and I was pleasantly surprised. The waffle alone is worth the trip, the ice cream is merely the cherry on top.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nutella ice cream on a sweet and pleasantly firm waffle.
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great place to relax.

2k8s4MV5t54OmR8I-4RRjw.text: After paying $5, my waffle with strawberries and whipped cream seemed weirdly small. But after the first bite everything made sense. The waffle itself is prepared perfectly; chewy on the inside, surrounded by a lightly sweet glaze that cooks to crispness. The toppings were high-quality and plentiful. Overall, totally worth it, even though it's a smallish square.  The stand also has Nutella, cookie butter, and rotating Dave and Andy's ice cream that you can get on a waffle, and milkshakes with Nutella or cookie butter which I'm excited to try.

dWt8jRZAmHwfkQmjr5OKvw.text: I don't know why, but I always roll up to waffallonia and wonder why I am so into it when I get my food since it just looks like a waffle with ice cream on it. I could make this at home! But then I start eating it and remember, the waffle is just so good, the thick texture and sugary sweetness and warmth paired with the cold ice cream is perfect. Their waffles really are just the best I have ever had. This location is in a little stall by Schenley plaza but they don't need that much space to do their thing and there's always plenty of seating outdoors, so I like to come here when it is warmer. I always like to get a waffle with vanilla ice cream (basics are best!) but I've had one with the speculoos ice cream and chocolate sauce which is good too.

KWi8-NRPquH-XlwDun0Eog.text: If you haven't had Waffallonia's Nutella milkshake you're totally missing out. This is the best milkshake I've ever had! Their waffle choices are great too! The wait isn't ever too bad and sitting in Schenley while you eat is always fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7eH9wyU5z5PWJU8UN4LLhg.text: I actually came to this place because The ice cream place I wanted to go to wasn't open yet.  I wasn't sure how I would like waffles and ice cream but I can now say they are an amazing pairing!!  I got a waffle with Nutella, strawberries, and two flavors of ice cream that I can't remember. The waffle and ice cream were delicious, I could have ate both by themselves.  So glad I stumbled across this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waffle!

VOXlaUzM0H4SKLEXPWBypg.text: I must admit that I was skeptical of this place at first. I generally think of waffles as being bland breakfast food at worst or vehicle for fried chicken and maple syrup at best. Waffallonia has definitely caused me to rethink how I view waffles though.  I ordered the Antwerp special (chocolate sauce + speculoos ice cream + sugar waffle), and it was absolutely phenomenal. The cooked sugar crystals on the exterior of the waffle provide a nice crunch that is an excellent textural contrast with the soft interior of the waffle. Anyone who has ever had the cookie butter from Trader Joe's knows how great speculoos tastes. The richness of the ice cream complemented the waffle really well. We savored every bite of this dessert and seriously contemplated ordering another one (we decided to save room for dinner).  If you are near Pitt and are looking for a snack/dessert, I would highly recommend checking out Waffallonia.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. With the menu in the background
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waffle with Speculoos Ice Cream and Chocolate Sauce

14JUr1k0kn9a1BhS_ID6ug.text: I typically don't like waffles but I LOVE this place. I used to come here once a month because they were just that good.   I would get a waffle with Nutella and vanilla ice cream. If I remember correctly, the ice cream was from dave and Andy's which is another Pittsburgh classic.   Love love love these waffles, I can't rave about them enough.

Io9o9ZHFewjwqmG82vXafA.text: Loved the waffle  I am new to the city and was looking for desserts and found this place  Must try

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pvq_v_mhwx5EOaERdT8sUw.text: What is not to love about Waffallonia? It's located in Schenley Plaza right across the road from the Cathedral and since I visit Cathy quite often, I find myself visiting Waffallonia probably more than I would like to admit.   I absolutely loveeeee the sugar waffles whether they are plain or topped with something wonderful. They are always fresh and made to order. Love them when they are super warm!! The main options are ice cream, Nutella, strawberries or bananas. Depending on the season, my go to choices are ice cream with Nutella and strawberries or Nutella, strawberries and bananas. Soooo delish.  The staff are always pleasant and the area is always clean. Plus you can almost always find a seat.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

IC1FpaTvC5nAiaoTlhNL-w.text: SC and I happened upon this while walking between the Phipps conservatory and the Cathedral of learning. It's situated in a large plaza with plenty of lawn and outdoor seating.   We ordered the Bruges which is their sugar waffle with strawberries and whip. It was the first time we've had a sugar waffle and we loved it! It provided a nice crunchy texture contrast to the flakiness of the dough and was paired perfectly with fresh fruit and a light whip that wasn't too sweet. A great mid day snack!!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KeQHNpyDwO9U6WiEQwnzkg.text: Oh man was this place amazing... I tried a waffle with Nutella spread, banana slices and a scoop of Nutella ice cream.  It was so good!!!   I highly recommend stopping here on a warm day to cool yourself with their ice cream!  They also have milkshakes, which too bad I am  already stuffed from the delicious dessert I had!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Un7OqVMzOKklZnNev9iRUA.text: Always amazing waffles here. Cute date night spot as well because you can walk around/lay down in schenley plaza after!

vlH_lDHbF_BcRma7t2u5iw.text: Not Open!  Arrived at 10:45 Saturday and waited to 11:05am, Trip to oakland for waffles fail.  Should have opened at 11am on a Saturday.  Waited around for a while but hangry partner could not wait.  Peeking inside it looked abandoned.  So why a 1 star review?  Ever walk into a restaurant before it opens and get scolded... well this is my way to scold the restaurant for not opening on time.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

CfVJWUkWxF5GD6uvPP_NCg.text: After passing this little stand so many times, I FINALLY tried a waffle treat from here and it was well worth the wait. I got the Waffallonia so that I could pick my own ice creams and toppings. The waffle was very crunchy on the outside and fluffy in the inside. I chose a soft cinnamon ice cream. The strawberries were pretty fresh. The waffle was well worth the wait, but I'm not sure about $6.27 unless you really pack on the toppings! I honestly thought the waffle could have been a little bigger, nonetheless, a great tasting treat!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waffallonia: Unlimited Toppings $6.27

ZaUhzf7C62GzWH4JSR3tbg.text: Wow! This place is absolutely a killer! If I could die eating one item, this would be it! The sugar waffle was crispy with a fluffy center! I had chopped strawberries, Nutella, bananas, and a scoop of Nutella ice cream on top. This was refreshingly sweet and the city college atmosphere added to an already wonderful dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

L09qhtnTGjfgBAdlE1JBtw.text: I love coming here during a nice weather walking around the park, I come here after eating at the porch or any other restaurants around. I get everything loaded onto my waffles in the waffle is chewing an amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZQnVnPWsoc93AGeunQHZMw.text: The most amazing gooey, sweet, moist waffle and ice cream I have ever had!!!! This little place is freaking amazing! The waffle is covered in this sweet luscious glaze and it has gooey goodness in the center. Ice cream, strawberries and whipped cream were fresh and wonderful. This is a must try in Pittsburgh!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hands down best waffle Sundae ever!!
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. the place

IOjrhe5AredewwRYR1mKOw.text: You can never go wrong with a Belgium waffle and some (or a lot of) toppings here and there... Wafflelonia is the perfect spot for a quick, filling, and satisfying dessert or snack. Going to school at CMU, it's a classic spot with two accessible locations (Squirrel Hill &a Oakland, although the Oakland location has limited hours of operations). The waffles are fresh, sweet, and delicious. My favorite is speculoos spread with cinnamon ice cream (pictured below). ~$6

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

giy5YHLdUhloD1EDarACkw.text: I would sell my soul for a Waffallonia waffle.   Maybe not, BUT they have made some of the best waffles I have ever had. The Antwerp ($5) is my go-to: a belgian waffle topped with an ice cream flavor of your choice and chocolate syrup. Simple yet magical. The soft ice cream melting over top of the warm, crunchy waffle is something dreams are made of (*cue Lizzie McGuire song*).  The wait can be brutally long, especially on nice days when everyone is out on Schenley Plaza. In my experience, they can take forever to fulfill an order, but hey, you can't rush perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Antwerp with Nutella ice cream

Qo71Kr5VhU0idRzCYrCtXg.text: Waffallonia's a good place for students to take a study break and grab a sweet bite to eat. I was first introduced to it as the waffle with unlimited toppings, which is called the Waffallonia waffle. Even just the regular sugar waffle itself is delicious and satisfies my cravings. There are other waffle types on the menu but I think the Waffallonia is the most popular option. This place is definitely popular when the the weather in Pittsburgh brightens up and it's sunny out. There's seating all around schenley plaza or you could even sit out on the lawn and enjoy your waffallonia.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nutella spread with strawberries and bananas on a sugar waffle
Photo of Waffallonia - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Enjoying waffallonia during Bigelow Bash

VsesT8N9cHB_KnHBkKdDaA.text: I love this place! On summer days, it's hard to resist the smell of fresh Belgian waffles when walking through Schenley Plaza :) Knowing I can add nutella ice cream to top it off makes it all the better - a delicious, filling treat that satisfies your sugar cravings for less than $5. Ordering is quick and easy since you just walk up and order through the window, only takes a few minutes.

7ZBNODchCihU4CFJ4-Pksg.text: The waffles were a disappointment, though the Nutella ice cream was real good the waffle was soggy and under cooked. The waffle should have been a bit more crispy.

xMzOjygffFZ8veqz_BOTYQ.text: Oh my, Waffallonia! Why, are you so delicious and perfectly decadent? You definitely have created an addiction for my sweet tooth.  I will dream of these yummy waffles and savor the moment when I will visit Pittsburgh again.   This little establishment is located in Schenley Park and is a perfect place for you to relax after a long day of sightseeing around the University of Pittsburgh and the surrounding Carnegie Museum of Natural History and Art. There are plenty of outdoor seating around this place or you can sit on the grass at the park.   The waffle is fluffy, lightly sweetened, and warm. There are several varieties that you can choose from but I decided to order Waffalonia for $6 because you can add as many toppings as you would like but will just receive smaller amounts of each. I ordered my waffle with Nutella (because who doesn't love Nutella?), strawberries, banana, and a scoop of creamy vanilla bean ice cream. The order came out really quickly after placing an order and the service was great as well. I barely made it in time to take a picture of this treat before taking an initial bite. I about died and gone to heaven when I tried it!  It was divine! It didn't take too long before my hubby and I finished eating it! I   I highly suggest coming here! You will not regret it! I am already looking forward to going again!
